name: Movies of Recent World History Online Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: "Gandhi" was about the legendary Indian leader. Who played the title role?
questions.explanation:
Ben Kingsley.

	A long movie by Richard Attenborough about an intriguing world figure.

questions.text: "The Killing Fields" dramatized the war in Southeast Asia - but the story was not set in Vietnam. Where did most of the action in the movie occur?
questions.explanation:
Cambodia.

	The extension of the war into Cambodia was the backdrop for this good movie.

questions.text: "Z" dramatized a political assassination in Greece. Who played the starring role?
Jack Lemmon and Sissy Spacek starred in "Missing". Where did most of the action in the story take place?
questions.explanation:
Chile.

	Turbulence in South America. Good movie.

questions.text: "Not Without My Daughter" described some of the tensions between the U.S. and Iran. Who played the starring role?
questions.explanation:
Sally Field.

	This may seem like an odd choice for this category ... but the movie did highlight the hostile nature of the relationship betrween the two countries (and its citizens).

questions.text: "Evita" was both a play and a movie. With what country is she associated?
questions.explanation:
Argentina.

	"Don't cry for me, Argentina". Etc.

questions.text: "Cry Freedom" dramatized problems in South Africa. Who played the key role?
questions.explanation:
Denzel Washington.

	Steven Biko and Apartheid.

questions.text: "Michael Collins" concerns a prominent figure in what country?
questions.explanation:
Ireland.

	Liam Neeson as the colorful figure.

questions.text: "Havana" is (obviously) about Cuba. Who was the star of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Robert Redford.

	Set in pre-Castro Cuba. Watchable.

questions.text: "Casualties of War" was set in Vietnam during the war. Who was the star?
questions.explanation:
Michael J. Fox

	Fox as the good guy (to Sean Penn's villain). Odd to see Fox in a dramatic role.
